page.title: 15Sky omens
page.content: There is a scene in the Bayeux Tapestry where the English look with astonishment at a star; they are afraid it's a bad sign. In fact it is {Halley's Comet. In Florence there is a{fresco paint- {ed by Giotto}in C13; Mr Finch says his daughter has seen it. The Wise Men are worshipping Jesus and in the sky is the star they followed. It's the Comet, and that's why a{spacecraft}has been named Giotto. This was launched in July, carrying ten experiments. It is due to meet Halley's Comet in{March 1986}and study the dust cloud and solar wind. It may survive only a few hours. Comets don't fit the normal pattern, so they have instilled gloom and doom. PS.{Christians}know their lives are not ruled by 'stars'. PPS. It rained on{St Swithin's day}!
